page.title: 10HISTORY.
page.content: The Parish of Mitton has 3 parts: Aighton, Bailey and Chaighley. In 1066, Aighton, which contains Stonyhurst, was owned by Tostig, brother of King Harold. After 1066 Roger of Poitou owned the land until Henry 1 gave it to Robert de Lacy in 1102. In 1135 Ralph le Rous took over control and the land was sold by his family 150 years later to the Earl of Lincoln. In 1329 the land was granted to Sir John de Shireburne. The Shireburne male-line died out, but the son of Richard Bayley and Margaret Shireburne took Shireburne as his surname.In 1538 Richard Shireburne inherited the land and held it for 60 years. He was knighted in 1544 and became an M.P. in the time of Mary 1.
